main.name: Matthew Plichta
main.description: I am a developer driven to create products that make the world a better place
main.bio: I started my professional career as a tiger trainer. My creative drive to solve problems led me to starting the WildHeart Foundation, a nonprofit with the goal of improving the lives of wild animals in captivity. As a founder and leader, I spearheaded new programs to raise donations in unique ways. It was through this work that I discovered my love of programming by building WildWish.org, an application to connect donors directly to the animals they are helping. I believe I am in this world for a purpose, and that purpose is to make the world a better place. I achieve this through my work of building products that enrich the lives of animals and people alike.
main.contactmessage: Send me a message. Ask me about the time I brought a lion to a party in Vegas.

resume.skillmessage: Languages I currently use. I'm always looking to learn new things.

education.description: I finished top of my cohort learning Ruby and JavaScript. This schooling built upon my self taught skills in order to build my passion project: WildWish.org
This on-the-job training program launched my career as a tiger trainer and zookeeper. Students spent 60 hours per week learning to care for big cats and bears in a working zoo.
